member.name: IMFMediaType.FreeRepresentation
member.summary: Frees memory that was allocated by the method.
member.param: GUID that was passed to the method.
Pointer to the buffer that was returned by the method.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFMediaType.GetMajorType
member.summary: Gets the major type of the format.
member.param: Receives the major type GUID. The major type describes the broad category of the format, such as audio or video. For a list of possible values, see Major Media Types.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The method succeeded.
The major type is not set.

member.name: IMFMediaType.GetRepresentation
member.summary: Retrieves an alternative representation of the media type. Currently only the DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure is supported.

param.name: guidRepresentation
param.para: GUID that specifies the representation to retrieve. The following values are defined.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
Convert the media type to a DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure. The method selects the most appropriate format structure (pbFormat).
Convert the media type to a DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure with an format structure.
Convert the media type to a DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure with a VIDEOINFOHEADER format structure.
Convert the media type to a DirectShow AM_MEDIA_TYPE structure with a VIDEOINFOHEADER2 format structure.

member.param: Receives a pointer to a structure that contains the representation. The method allocates the memory for the structure. The caller must release the memory by calling .

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The method succeeded.
The details of the media type do not match the requested representation.
The media type is not valid.
The media type does not support the requested representation.

member.name: IMFMediaType.IsCompressedFormat
member.summary: Queries whether the media type is a temporally compressed format.Temporal compression uses information from previously decoded samples when decompressing the current sample.
member.param: Receives a Boolean value. The value is TRUE if the format uses temporal compression, or FALSE if the format does not use temporal compression.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IMFMediaType.IsEqual
member.summary: Compares two media types and determines whether they are identical. If they are not identical, the method indicates how the two formats differ.
member.param: Pointer to the interface of the media type to compare.

param.name: pdwFlags
param.para: Receives a bitwise OR of zero or more flags, indicating the degree of similarity between the two media types. The following flags are defined.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
The major types are the same. The major type is specified by the MF_MT_MAJOR_TYPE attribute.
The subtypes are the same, or neither media type has a subtype. The subtype is specified by the MF_MT_SUBTYPE attribute.

The attributes in one of the media types are a subset of the attributes in the other, and the values of these attributes match, excluding the value of the MF_MT_USER_DATA, MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MIN, and MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MAX attributes.
Specifically, the method takes the media type with the smaller number of attributes and checks whether each attribute from that type is present in the other media type and has the same value (not including MF_MT_USER_DATA, MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MIN, and MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MAX).
To perform other comparisons, use the method. For example, the Compare method can test for identical attributes, or test the intersection of the two attribute sets. For more information, see .
The user data is identical, or neither media type contains user data. User data is specified by the MF_MT_USER_DATA attribute.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: Return code
Description
The types are not equal. Examine the pdwFlags parameter to determine how the types differ.
The types are equal.
One or both media types are invalid.

member.name: IMFMediaType
member.summary: Represents a description of a media format.
